oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Printed letter welcoming American troops from King George V
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A printed letter having the appearance of a hand written note that was given to Pvt. Spencer Samuel Ferguson "as I stepped off the boat after crossing the Atlantic." The document is a copy of a letter written by King George welcoming US troops to the Allied war effort. A copy was given to each doughboy upon his arrival in England. Ferguson, from Hickman County, Tennessee, served in the 1st Casual Ordnance Battalion.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
